subject: Re: [junit] Testing Static class behavior
msgSnippet: No, Thomas, you didn t miss anything. Mark was making another suggestion. I m not sure whether I like it. In my work with singletons, I have invariably
messageBody:
No, Thomas, you didn't miss anything. Mark was making another suggestion.
I'm not sure whether I like it.

In my work with singletons, I have invariably concluded that must of them
did not need to be singletons. I usually turn singletons into otherwise
normal classes and use factories, where necessary. This was the reason for
my suggestion.

If you find that you really want a singleton, let's revisit this question
and see if we can solve it. :)

===========================================
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services Inc.
Software development with Java and Extreme Programming
